phase25.title: Essential Features ‚Äî Notifications + Evaluation + Logs + Search + Analytics
phase25.goal: Add daily habits, communication, visibility, and light performance tracking to make the system feel alive and useful on a day-to-day basis. Increase user retention and daily active usage.
phase25.deliverable: üéØ Users receive timely notifications. Managers can assign goals and run basic reviews. Employees log daily work. Everyone finds data quickly. Leadership gets simple visibility into activity and performance trends.

phase3.title: Collaboration ‚Äî Tasks, Chat, Files & HR Actions
phase3.goal: Transform the system from individual tracking into a collaborative workspace. Enable file sharing, discussions, real-time communication, and formal HR documentation ‚Äî making the platform the central place for team & HR interaction.
phase3.deliverable: üéØ Team members can discuss tasks, attach files, mention colleagues, see activity history. HR can record formal actions. Basic internal chat and external tool integrations (GitHub/Gmail) are in place ‚Äî turning the platform into a collaborative HR & work hub.

phase3.criteria6: Basic real-time chat works between users and in groups
phase3.criteria7: All collaboration features respect RBAC and tenant isolation
phase3.criteria8: System feels like a connected team workspace, not just a tracker

phase4.title: Scale & Polish ‚Äì Performance, Offline, Jobs & Reporting
phase4.goal: Make the application production-ready: fast, reliable, installable, offline-capable, and capable of handling scheduled & heavy workloads. Deliver professional-grade reports and bring polish to every interaction.
phase4.deliverable: üéØ App is installable on mobile/desktop, works offline for core views, loads noticeably faster, handles background tasks reliably, and delivers professional-looking scheduled & on-demand reports.
phase4.criteria1: App can be installed on mobile/desktop with custom icon
phase4.criteria2: Core views (dashboard, employee list) work offline
phase4.criteria3: Push notifications for mentions/approvals/reminders are delivered
phase4.criteria5: Long-running tasks (imports, reports) run in background without blocking UI
phase4.criteria6: Reports can be exported as styled PDF and scheduled via email
phase4.criteria7: Bundle size reduced meaningfully from previous phase
phase4.criteria8: Application feels snappy and professional even on slower connections

roadmap.phase5.title: Custom Backend + Data Migration + Gradual Cutover
roadmap.phase5.goal: If Supabase becomes a limiting factor (cost, performance, customization, compliance), migrate to a fully owned custom backend. Achieve full feature parity, zero-downtime data migration, and safe gradual rollout without disrupting users.
roadmap.phase5.decision.title: Decision & Planning
roadmap.phase5.decision.description: Evaluate whether custom backend is truly necessary and define migration strategy
roadmap.phase5.decision.analysisDesc: Cost at projected scale, query performance, row-level-security complexity, edge function limits, vendor lock-in concerns
roadmap.phase5.decision.targetDesc: NestJS/TypeScript, FastAPI/Python, Go Fiber/Gin, Spring Boot ‚Äî based on team expertise & long-term needs
roadmap.phase5.decision.architectureDesc: API structure, authentication (JWT + refresh), authorization (RBAC), event bus / queues, database choice (PostgreSQL / other)
roadmap.phase5.decision.migration: Migration Strategy (Big Bang vs Strangler Fig vs Hybrid)
roadmap.phase5.decision.migrationDesc: Decide gradual rollout: feature-by-feature proxy, read-from-new/write-to-both, dual-write pattern
roadmap.phase5.backend.title: Custom Backend Development
roadmap.phase5.backend.description: Build production-ready backend with feature parity
roadmap.phase5.backend.authDesc: JWT + refresh tokens, Supabase ‚Üí custom auth migration path, role/permission enforcement
roadmap.phase5.backend.crudDesc: Employees, companies, goals, evaluations, work-logs, comments, notifications, files‚Ä¶
roadmap.phase5.backend.realtimeDesc: WebSockets (Socket.IO / ws), Redis Pub/Sub, or third-party (Pusher, Ably) to replace Supabase Realtime
roadmap.phase5.backend.storageDesc: S3 / Cloudflare R2 / MinIO + signed URLs, replace Supabase Storage
roadmap.phase5.migration.title: Data Migration & Consistency
roadmap.phase5.migration.description: Safely move data from Supabase ‚Üí new database with zero / minimal downtime
roadmap.phase5.migration.schemaDesc: Prisma / Drizzle / TypeORM / Knex migrations ‚Äî full schema parity
roadmap.phase5.migration.initialDesc: One-time migration of all existing data (pg_dump / custom ETL script)
roadmap.phase5.migration.syncDesc: Dual-write during transition or Supabase ‚Üí new DB replication (Debezium, custom triggers)
roadmap.phase5.migration.validationDesc: Row count checks, hash comparisons, sample audits, rollback plan
roadmap.phase5.rollout.title: Gradual Rollout & Cutover
roadmap.phase5.rollout.description: Deploy new backend safely with feature flags and traffic shifting
roadmap.phase5.rollout.flagsDesc: LaunchDarkly / Unleash / custom ‚Üí route specific companies/users to new backend
roadmap.phase5.rollout.monitoringDesc: Prometheus/Grafana, Sentry, Datadog, logs comparison between old & new
roadmap.phase5.rollout.cutoverDesc: Traffic shift 100% ‚Üí new backend, disable Supabase writes, eventual full shutdown
roadmap.phase5.rollout.fallbackDesc: DNS rollback, database snapshot restore, communication plan
roadmap.phase5.deliverable: üéØ (If triggered) Fully custom backend running in production. All data successfully migrated. Old Supabase instance read-only or decommissioned. Zero major incidents during cutover. Team has full ownership and control over the entire stack.
roadmap.phase5.criteria1: Custom backend handles 100% of production traffic
roadmap.phase5.criteria3: No major downtime or user-visible regressions during cutover
roadmap.phase5.criteria4: Performance equal or better than Supabase (API latency, throughput)
roadmap.phase5.criteria6: Cost model understood and predictable at current + projected scale
roadmap.phase5.criteria7: Team has full confidence in operating, debugging and scaling the new stack
roadmap.phase5.criteria8: Supabase instance safely decommissioned or reduced to archive-only
